## Discussion

A positive [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] value represents the estimated uncertainty associated with [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude]. This value is available whenever altitude values are available.

If [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] is `0` or a negative number, [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude] values are invalid. If [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] is a postive number, [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude] values are valid.

A positive [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] value represents an uncertainty that’s approximately 68 percent, or one standard deviation, above and below the altitude values.

# verticalAccuracy

**Instance Property**

The validity of the altitude values, and their estimated uncertainty, measured in meters.

## Declaration

```swift
var verticalAccuracy: CLLocationAccuracy { get }
```

## Discussion

A positive [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] value represents the estimated uncertainty associated with [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude]. This value is available whenever altitude values are available.

If [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] is `0` or a negative number, [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude] values are invalid. If [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] is a postive number, [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/altitude] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/ellipsoidalAltitude] values are valid.

A positive [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocation/verticalAccuracy] value represents an uncertainty that’s approximately 68 percent, or one standard deviation, above and below the altitude values.



## Getting the location accuracy

- **horizontalAccuracy**: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters.
- **CLLocationAccuracy**: The accuracy of a geographical coordinate.
